page.title: 13BUILDINGS, CHITTERNE
page.content: The only relic of the old church of All Saint's is part of the graveyard, now largely surrounded by farm buildings, some old, some new, and the large 17th Century stone house of Manor Farm. The 19th Century flint and stone church of All Saint's has been built on a new site. There are several quite large old houses in this northern part of the village; one having been built in the 17th Century as a hunting lodge, and one which was an old 16th Century Priory and includes St.Andrew's Chapel with a stone arched gateway into the courtyard. Many of the houses are built of stone and flint but often include brick and/or plaster facings.Apart from Manor Farm there is another substantial stone and brick farmhouse and an old closed square range of loose boxes for racehorses.
